result.execSummary:
The defendant Javod Diearre Petty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

superMiscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Random urine screens. No positive results.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Defendant advised the he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

supervisions.notes: Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 2 years initial confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javod Diearre Petty

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, for review.  spc

Count one.  

(return address: Javod Petty #392932, MSDF, PO Box 05911, Milwaukee, WI 53205)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER P.O.BOX 36 WINNEBAGO WI 54985

Signed by Br.11 for Br. 17.

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

IN all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 17 Judge Stark.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Credit, signed and filed. 
It is Hereby Ordered that the defendant's request for sentence credit is DENIED. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, calendar successor, for review. mag
DOC request for sentence credit.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Javod Diearre Petty not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution. Case moot. No action taken.

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   

  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 1/2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 1/2 years years with credit for 0 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. after 2 years initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Court denied defense counsel's motion for modification of bail.

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held.  Speedy trial demand WITHDRAWN.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4-23-14, 9:00 a.m.
Filed by the State:  Requested Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine, Witness List
Filed by the Defense:  Proposed Jury Instructions.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Javod Diearre Petty not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court DENIED defense motion for modification of bail.  Jury trial date rescheduled due to court unavailability.  Court can still accommodate speedy trial demand.  Jury trial scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Due to court's calendar, Final pretrial rescheduled to March 27, 2014 at 8:30 am. Clerk notified Attorney Kastenson and state.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Javod Diearre Petty not in court, in custody.  William M. Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court DENIED defense motion for modification of bail.  Case set for final pretrial on 3-24-14, 8:30 and  Jury trial scheduled for 04-07-2014 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Dennis Murphy Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF3874 that are attached to the complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Javod Diearre Petty in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
